27#include <sys/cdefs.h>
28__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: nouveau_nvkm_subdev_clk_gt215.c,v 1.4 2019/02/18 23:19:36 christos Exp $");
29
30#define gt215_clk(p) container_of((p), struct gt215_clk, base)
31#include "gt215.h"
32#include "pll.h"
33
34#include <engine/fifo.h>
35#include <subdev/bios.h>
36#include <subdev/bios/pll.h>
37#include <subdev/timer.h>
38
39struct gt215_clk {
40 struct nvkm_clk base;
41 struct gt215_clk_info eng[nv_clk_src_max];
42};
43
44static u32 read_clk(struct gt215_clk *, int, bool);
45static u32 read_pll(struct gt215_clk *, int, u32);
46
47static u32
48read_vco(struct gt215_clk *clk, int idx)
49{
50 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->base.subdev.device;
51 u32 sctl = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x4120 + (idx * 4));
52
53 switch (sctl & 0x00000030) {
54 case 0x00000000:
55 return device->crystal;
56 case 0x00000020:
57 return read_pll(clk, 0x41, 0x00e820);
58 case 0x00000030:
59 return read_pll(clk, 0x42, 0x00e8a0);
60 default:
61 return 0;
62 }
63}
64
65static u32
66read_clk(struct gt215_clk *clk, int idx, bool ignore_en)
67{
68 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->base.subdev.device;
69 u32 sctl, sdiv, sclk;
70
71 /* refclk for the 0xe8xx plls is a fixed frequency */
72 if (idx >= 0x40) {
73 if (device->chipset == 0xaf) {
74 /* no joke.. seriously.. sigh.. */
75 return nvkm_rd32(device, 0x00471c) * 1000;
76 }
77
78 return device->crystal;
79 }
80
81 sctl = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x4120 + (idx * 4));
82 if (!ignore_en && !(sctl & 0x00000100))
83 return 0;
84
85 /* out_alt */
86 if (sctl & 0x00000400)
87 return 108000;
88
89 /* vco_out */
90 switch (sctl & 0x00003000) {
91 case 0x00000000:
92 if (!(sctl & 0x00000200))
93 return device->crystal;
94 return 0;
95 case 0x00002000:
96 if (sctl & 0x00000040)
97 return 108000;
98 return 100000;
99 case 0x00003000:
100 /* vco_enable */
101 if (!(sctl & 0x00000001))
102 return 0;
103
104 sclk = read_vco(clk, idx);
105 sdiv = ((sctl & 0x003f0000) >> 16) + 2;
106 return (sclk * 2) / sdiv;
107 default:
108 return 0;
109 }
110}
111
112static u32
113read_pll(struct gt215_clk *clk, int idx, u32 pll)
114{
115 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->base.subdev.device;
116 u32 ctrl = nvkm_rd32(device, pll + 0);
117 u32 sclk = 0, P = 1, N = 1, M = 1;
118
119 if (!(ctrl & 0x00000008)) {
120 if (ctrl & 0x00000001) {
121 u32 coef = nvkm_rd32(device, pll + 4);
122 M = (coef & 0x000000ff) >> 0;
123 N = (coef & 0x0000ff00) >> 8;
124 P = (coef & 0x003f0000) >> 16;
125
126 /* no post-divider on these..
127 * XXX: it looks more like two post-"dividers" that
128 * cross each other out in the default RPLL config */
129 if ((pll & 0x00ff00) == 0x00e800)
130 P = 1;
131
132 sclk = read_clk(clk, 0x00 + idx, false);
133 }
134 } else {
135 sclk = read_clk(clk, 0x10 + idx, false);
136 }
137
138 u32 mp = M * P;
139 if (mp != 0)
140 return sclk * N / mp;
141
142 return 0;
143}
144
145static int
146gt215_clk_read(struct nvkm_clk *base, enum nv_clk_src src)
147{
148 struct gt215_clk *clk = gt215_clk(base);
149 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &clk->base.subdev;
150 struct nvkm_device *device = subdev->device;
151 u32 hsrc;
152
153 switch (src) {
154 case nv_clk_src_crystal:
155 return device->crystal;
156 case nv_clk_src_core:
157 case nv_clk_src_core_intm:
158 return read_pll(clk, 0x00, 0x4200);
159 case nv_clk_src_shader:
160 return read_pll(clk, 0x01, 0x4220);
161 case nv_clk_src_mem:
162 return read_pll(clk, 0x02, 0x4000);
163 case nv_clk_src_disp:
164 return read_clk(clk, 0x20, false);
165 case nv_clk_src_vdec:
166 return read_clk(clk, 0x21, false);
167 case nv_clk_src_daemon:
168 return read_clk(clk, 0x25, false);
169 case nv_clk_src_host:
170 hsrc = (nvkm_rd32(device, 0xc040) & 0x30000000) >> 28;
171 switch (hsrc) {
172 case 0:
173 return read_clk(clk, 0x1d, false);
174 case 2:
175 case 3:
176 return 277000;
177 default:
178 nvkm_error(subdev, "unknown HOST clock source %d\n", hsrc);
179 return -EINVAL;
180 }
181 default:
182 nvkm_error(subdev, "invalid clock source %d\n", src);
183 return -EINVAL;
184 }
185
186 return 0;
187}
188
189static int
190gt215_clk_info(struct nvkm_clk *base, int idx, u32 khz,
191 struct gt215_clk_info *info)
192{
193 struct gt215_clk *clk = gt215_clk(base);
194 u32 oclk, sclk, sdiv;
195 s32 diff;
196
197 info->clk = 0;
198
199 switch (khz) {
200 case 27000:
201 info->clk = 0x00000100;
202 return khz;
203 case 100000:
204 info->clk = 0x00002100;
205 return khz;
206 case 108000:
207 info->clk = 0x00002140;
208 return khz;
209 default:
210 sclk = read_vco(clk, idx);
211 sdiv = min((sclk * 2) / khz, (u32)65);
212 oclk = (sclk * 2) / sdiv;
213 diff = ((khz + 3000) - oclk);
214
215 /* When imprecise, play it safe and aim for a clock lower than
216 * desired rather than higher */
217 if (diff < 0) {
218 sdiv++;
219 oclk = (sclk * 2) / sdiv;
220 }
221
222 /* divider can go as low as 2, limited here because NVIDIA
223 * and the VBIOS on my NVA8 seem to prefer using the PLL
224 * for 810MHz - is there a good reason?
225 * XXX: PLLs with refclk 810MHz? */
226 if (sdiv > 4) {
227 info->clk = (((sdiv - 2) << 16) | 0x00003100);
228 return oclk;
229 }
230
231 break;
232 }
233
234 return -ERANGE;
235}
236
237int
238gt215_pll_info(struct nvkm_clk *base, int idx, u32 pll, u32 khz,
239 struct gt215_clk_info *info)
240{
241 struct gt215_clk *clk = gt215_clk(base);
242 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &clk->base.subdev;
243 struct nvbios_pll limits;
244 int P, N, M, diff;
245 int ret;
246
247 info->pll = 0;
248
249 /* If we can get a within [-2, 3) MHz of a divider, we'll disable the
250 * PLL and use the divider instead. */
251 ret = gt215_clk_info(&clk->base, idx, khz, info);
252 diff = khz - ret;
253 if (!pll || (diff >= -2000 && diff < 3000)) {
254 goto out;
255 }
256
257 /* Try with PLL */
258 ret = nvbios_pll_parse(subdev->device->bios, pll, &limits);
259 if (ret)
260 return ret;
261
262 ret = gt215_clk_info(&clk->base, idx - 0x10, limits.refclk, info);
263 if (ret != limits.refclk)
264 return -EINVAL;
265
266 ret = gt215_pll_calc(subdev, &limits, khz, &N, NULL, &M, &P);
267 if (ret >= 0) {
268 info->pll = (P << 16) | (N << 8) | M;
269 }
270
271out:
272 info->fb_delay = max(((khz + 7566) / 15133), (u32) 18);
273 return ret ? ret : -ERANGE;
274}
275
276static int
277calc_clk(struct gt215_clk *clk, struct nvkm_cstate *cstate,
278 int idx, u32 pll, int dom)
279{
280 int ret = gt215_pll_info(&clk->base, idx, pll, cstate->domain[dom],
281 &clk->eng[dom]);
282 if (ret >= 0)
283 return 0;
284 return ret;
285}
286
287static int
288calc_host(struct gt215_clk *clk, struct nvkm_cstate *cstate)
289{
290 int ret = 0;
291 u32 kHz = cstate->domain[nv_clk_src_host];
292 struct gt215_clk_info *info = &clk->eng[nv_clk_src_host];
293
294 if (kHz == 277000) {
295 info->clk = 0;
296 info->host_out = NVA3_HOST_277;
297 return 0;
298 }
299
300 info->host_out = NVA3_HOST_CLK;
301
302 ret = gt215_clk_info(&clk->base, 0x1d, kHz, info);
303 if (ret >= 0)
304 return 0;
305
306 return ret;
307}
308
309int
310gt215_clk_pre(struct nvkm_clk *clk, unsigned long *flags)
311{
312 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->subdev.device;
313 struct nvkm_fifo *fifo = device->fifo;
314
315 /* halt and idle execution engines */
316 nvkm_mask(device, 0x020060, 0x00070000, 0x00000000);
317 nvkm_mask(device, 0x002504, 0x00000001, 0x00000001);
318 /* Wait until the interrupt handler is finished */
319 if (nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
320 if (!nvkm_rd32(device, 0x000100))
321 break;
322 ) < 0)
323 return -EBUSY;
324
325 if (fifo)
326 nvkm_fifo_pause(fifo, flags);
327
328 if (nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
329 if (nvkm_rd32(device, 0x002504) & 0x00000010)
330 break;
331 ) < 0)
332 return -EIO;
333
334 if (nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
335 u32 tmp = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x00251c) & 0x0000003f;
336 if (tmp == 0x0000003f)
337 break;
338 ) < 0)
339 return -EIO;
340
341 return 0;
342}
343
344void
345gt215_clk_post(struct nvkm_clk *clk, unsigned long *flags)
346{
347 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->subdev.device;
348 struct nvkm_fifo *fifo = device->fifo;
349
350 if (fifo && flags)
351 nvkm_fifo_start(fifo, flags);
352
353 nvkm_mask(device, 0x002504, 0x00000001, 0x00000000);
354 nvkm_mask(device, 0x020060, 0x00070000, 0x00040000);
355}
356
357static void
358disable_clk_src(struct gt215_clk *clk, u32 src)
359{
360 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->base.subdev.device;
361 nvkm_mask(device, src, 0x00000100, 0x00000000);
362 nvkm_mask(device, src, 0x00000001, 0x00000000);
363}
364
365static void
366prog_pll(struct gt215_clk *clk, int idx, u32 pll, int dom)
367{
368 struct gt215_clk_info *info = &clk->eng[dom];
369 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->base.subdev.device;
370 const u32 src0 = 0x004120 + (idx * 4);
371 const u32 src1 = 0x004160 + (idx * 4);
372 const u32 ctrl = pll + 0;
373 const u32 coef = pll + 4;
374 u32 bypass;
375
376 if (info->pll) {
377 /* Always start from a non-PLL clock */
378 bypass = nvkm_rd32(device, ctrl) & 0x00000008;
379 if (!bypass) {
380 nvkm_mask(device, src1, 0x00000101, 0x00000101);
381 nvkm_mask(device, ctrl, 0x00000008, 0x00000008);
382 udelay(20);
383 }
384
385 nvkm_mask(device, src0, 0x003f3141, 0x00000101 | info->clk);
386 nvkm_wr32(device, coef, info->pll);
387 nvkm_mask(device, ctrl, 0x00000015, 0x00000015);
388 nvkm_mask(device, ctrl, 0x00000010, 0x00000000);
389 if (nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
390 if (nvkm_rd32(device, ctrl) & 0x00020000)
391 break;
392 ) < 0) {
393 nvkm_mask(device, ctrl, 0x00000010, 0x00000010);
394 nvkm_mask(device, src0, 0x00000101, 0x00000000);
395 return;
396 }
397 nvkm_mask(device, ctrl, 0x00000010, 0x00000010);
398 nvkm_mask(device, ctrl, 0x00000008, 0x00000000);
399 disable_clk_src(clk, src1);
400 } else {
401 nvkm_mask(device, src1, 0x003f3141, 0x00000101 | info->clk);
402 nvkm_mask(device, ctrl, 0x00000018, 0x00000018);
403 udelay(20);
404 nvkm_mask(device, ctrl, 0x00000001, 0x00000000);
405 disable_clk_src(clk, src0);
406 }
407}
408
409static void
410prog_clk(struct gt215_clk *clk, int idx, int dom)
411{
412 struct gt215_clk_info *info = &clk->eng[dom];
413 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->base.subdev.device;
414 nvkm_mask(device, 0x004120 + (idx * 4), 0x003f3141, 0x00000101 | info->clk);
415}
416
417static void
418prog_host(struct gt215_clk *clk)
419{
420 struct gt215_clk_info *info = &clk->eng[nv_clk_src_host];
421 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->base.subdev.device;
422 u32 hsrc = (nvkm_rd32(device, 0xc040));
423
424 switch (info->host_out) {
425 case NVA3_HOST_277:
426 if ((hsrc & 0x30000000) == 0) {
427 nvkm_wr32(device, 0xc040, hsrc | 0x20000000);
428 disable_clk_src(clk, 0x4194);
429 }
430 break;
431 case NVA3_HOST_CLK:
432 prog_clk(clk, 0x1d, nv_clk_src_host);
433 if ((hsrc & 0x30000000) >= 0x20000000) {
434 nvkm_wr32(device, 0xc040, hsrc & ~0x30000000);
435 }
436 break;
437 default:
438 break;
439 }
440
441 /* This seems to be a clock gating factor on idle, always set to 64 */
442 nvkm_wr32(device, 0xc044, 0x3e);
443}
444
445static void
446prog_core(struct gt215_clk *clk, int dom)
447{
448 struct gt215_clk_info *info = &clk->eng[dom];
449 struct nvkm_device *device = clk->base.subdev.device;
450 u32 fb_delay = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10002c);
451
452 if (fb_delay < info->fb_delay)
453 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10002c, info->fb_delay);
454
455 prog_pll(clk, 0x00, 0x004200, dom);
456
457 if (fb_delay > info->fb_delay)
458 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10002c, info->fb_delay);
459}
460
461static int
462gt215_clk_calc(struct nvkm_clk *base, struct nvkm_cstate *cstate)
463{
464 struct gt215_clk *clk = gt215_clk(base);
465 struct gt215_clk_info *core = &clk->eng[nv_clk_src_core];
466 int ret;
467
468 if ((ret = calc_clk(clk, cstate, 0x10, 0x4200, nv_clk_src_core)) ||
469 (ret = calc_clk(clk, cstate, 0x11, 0x4220, nv_clk_src_shader)) ||
470 (ret = calc_clk(clk, cstate, 0x20, 0x0000, nv_clk_src_disp)) ||
471 (ret = calc_clk(clk, cstate, 0x21, 0x0000, nv_clk_src_vdec)) ||
472 (ret = calc_host(clk, cstate)))
473 return ret;
474
475 /* XXX: Should be reading the highest bit in the VBIOS clock to decide
476 * whether to use a PLL or not... but using a PLL defeats the purpose */
477 if (core->pll) {
478 ret = gt215_clk_info(&clk->base, 0x10,
479 cstate->domain[nv_clk_src_core_intm],
480 &clk->eng[nv_clk_src_core_intm]);
481 if (ret < 0)
482 return ret;
483 }
484
485 return 0;
486}
487
488static int
489gt215_clk_prog(struct nvkm_clk *base)
490{
491 struct gt215_clk *clk = gt215_clk(base);
492 struct gt215_clk_info *core = &clk->eng[nv_clk_src_core];
493 int ret = 0;
494 unsigned long flags;
495 unsigned long *f = &flags;
496
497 ret = gt215_clk_pre(&clk->base, f);
498 if (ret)
499 goto out;
500
501 if (core->pll)
502 prog_core(clk, nv_clk_src_core_intm);
503
504 prog_core(clk, nv_clk_src_core);
505 prog_pll(clk, 0x01, 0x004220, nv_clk_src_shader);
506 prog_clk(clk, 0x20, nv_clk_src_disp);
507 prog_clk(clk, 0x21, nv_clk_src_vdec);
508 prog_host(clk);
509
510out:
511 if (ret == -EBUSY)
512 f = NULL;
513
514 gt215_clk_post(&clk->base, f);
515 return ret;
516}
517
518static void
519gt215_clk_tidy(struct nvkm_clk *base)
520{
521}
522
523static const struct nvkm_clk_func
524gt215_clk = {
525 .read = gt215_clk_read,
526 .calc = gt215_clk_calc,
527 .prog = gt215_clk_prog,
528 .tidy = gt215_clk_tidy,
529 .domains = {
530 { nv_clk_src_crystal , 0xff },
531 { nv_clk_src_core , 0x00, 0, "core", 1000 },
532 { nv_clk_src_shader , 0x01, 0, "shader", 1000 },
533 { nv_clk_src_mem , 0x02, 0, "memory", 1000 },
534 { nv_clk_src_vdec , 0x03 },
535 { nv_clk_src_disp , 0x04 },
536 { nv_clk_src_host , 0x05 },
537 { nv_clk_src_core_intm, 0x06 },
538 { nv_clk_src_max }
539 }
540};
541
542int
543gt215_clk_new(struct nvkm_device *device, int index, struct nvkm_clk **pclk)
544{
545 struct gt215_clk *clk;
546
547 if (!(clk = kzalloc(sizeof(*clk), GFP_KERNEL)))
548 return -ENOMEM;
549 *pclk = &clk->base;
550
551 return nvkm_clk_ctor(&gt215_clk, device, index, true, &clk->base);
552}
